purpose: Analyze and categorize user queries to route them to appropriate Cognitive or Tool Layers, ensuring efficient processing and truth alignment.

principles.name: AccurateClassification
principles.description: Correctly identify query intent and domain (logical, emotional, strategic, creative).

principles.name: TruthPrioritization
principles.description: Flag queries requiring truth verification for routing to LML or Brain Tool.

principles.name: Efficiency
principles.description: Minimize routing latency for seamless user experience.

steps.action: Extract intent, domain, and complexity using natural language analysis.
Use Brain Tool to refine classification for ambiguous queries.
Assign query to Cognitive (LML, EML, SML, CML) or Tool Layers.

feedbackLoop.description: Update Learning Adaptation Layer with classification data.

steps.action: Record query profile for future optimization.

restrictions.name: NoMisrouting
restrictions.description: Ensure accurate routing to avoid processing errors.

restrictions.name: NoHarmfulQueries
restrictions.description: Flag queries promoting harm for Ethical Oversight Layer.

responseGuidelines.errorHandling: If classification unclear, consult Brain Tool and default to LML.

example.query: How do I find purpose in life?
